label: Native American Authors
description: Decolonize your bookshelf with these books by Native American Authors

list.label: Flight: A Novel, by Sherman Alexie
The Absolutely True Diary of a Part-Time Indian, by Sherman Alexie
Lakota Woman, by Mary Brave Bird
Code Talker: A Novel About the Navajo Marines of World War Two, by Joseph Bruchac
Custer Died for Your Sins: An Indian Manifesto, by Vine Deloria
The Marrow Thieves, by Cherie Dimaline
An Indigenous Peoples' History of the United States, by Roxanne Dunbar-Ortiz
Future Home of the Living God: A Novel, by Louise Erdrich
Love Medicine, by Louise Erdrich
Night Watchman, by Louise Erdrich
The Round House, by Louise Erdrich
Crooked Hallelujah, by Kelli Jo Ford
If I Ever Get Out of Here: A Novel with Paintings, by Eric Gansworth
An Amerian Sunrise: Poems, by Joy Harjo
Crazy Brave: A Memoir, by Joy Harjo
The Removed: A Novel, by Brandon Hobson
Where the Dead Sit Talking, by Brandon Hobson
The Only Good Indians, by Stephen Graham Jones
Braiding Sweetgrass: Indigenous Wisdom, Scientific Knowledge, and the Teaching of Plants, by Robin Wall Kimmerer
Elatsoe, by Darcie Little Badger
James Welch: A Critical Companion, by Mary Jane Lupton
Heart Berries: A Memoir, by Terese Marie Mailhot
An Indigenous Peoples' History of the United States for Young People, by Jean Mendoza
New Poets of Native Nations
There There, by Tommy Orange
IRL, by Tommy Pico
Black Sun, by Rebecca Roanhorse
Trail of Lightning, by Rebecca Roanhorse
This Town Sleeps, by Dennis E. Staples
Split Tooth, by Tanya Tagaq
The Heartbeat of Wounded Knee: Native America from 1890 to the Present
Cherokee America, by Margaret Verble
Two Old Women: An Alaska Legend of Betrayal, Courage, and Survival, by Velma Wallis
Men We Reaped: A Memoir, by Jesmyn Ward
Sing, Unburied, Sing: A Novel, by Jesmyn Ward
Winter Counts: A Novel, by David Heska Wanbli Weiden
When the Light of the World Was Subdued, Our Songs Came Through: A Norton Anthology of Native Nations Poetry
Jonny Appleseed, by Joshua Whitehead
